conclusion: We have a trapezoidal frame made of resistive wire with resistivity ρ and cross-sectional area S.
The trapezoid has sides AB, BC, CD, and DA.
Sides AB and CD form 60° angles with side AD.
All sides have length L: ab = bc = cd = L.
The frame is connected to a power source with EMF E (negligible internal resistance).
A uniform magnetic field B is perpendicular to the frame plane, pointing horizontally inward.

premise: Resistance of a wire is given by R = ρ(l/S).
conclusion: Total length of the wire l_total = AB + BC + CD + DA = 4L.

premise: Total length of the wire l_total = 4L.

conclusion: Segment AB makes a 60° angle with the horizontal.

premise: Segment AB makes a 60° angle with the horizontal.
Length vector l_AB = L(0.5i + 0.866j) and magnetic field B = Bk.
conclusion: Cross product l_AB x B = LB(0.866i - 0.5j).

premise: Cross product l_AB x B = LB(0.866i - 0.5j) and current I = ES/(4ρL).
Length vector l_BC = Li and magnetic field B = Bk.
Cross product l_BC x B = -LBj and current I = ES/(4ρL).

conclusion: Segment CD makes a -60° angle with the horizontal.
